text:
Hi, @channel. We just had our first go at using the cli. Fetched from prod, pushed to dev portal and so on. Seems to work fine. (Only thing missing is a local server and local content as JSON w/tooling to sync)
We had a look at our own existing prod portal, where we got a bounch of "old style" JSON template files. Then we had a look at the CMS boilerplate stuff, which is pure "dnd". Will you champion dnd as the future, or will both methods be equally prioritized? Seems to me the dnd is the better option?
(On a sidenote, we never figured how to make sandboxes, so fell back to 90 day accounts on our dev portal)
Good question <@UP2ESHDGX> - I'm after an answer on this too!
I much prefer the idea of the dnd approach - especially as I prefer the config-as-code approach and being able to have all my layouts commited to a git repository.
There is a local server, for the dnd stuff i believe
I tend to agree. Learned a lot about how content is structured today vs. how we do it in "my camp". (MS / <http://ASP.NET|ASP.NET> part of our company) :grin:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-hubl-server>
I guess it depends what the theme is for.
afaik that's very old and never worked well
Is it one you're looking to put on the marketplace?
so probably don't work at all with dnd?
no, just trying to get a professional workflow for our designers. :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
In that case
Personally, i think based on the documentation I'd use the dnd stuff (even though it's subject to change)
seems simpler, yes
but.. realistically, i think it makes sense to go module first
As you can include modules using hubl
if i was working that way, i'd likely use bitbucket+bitbucket pipelines to automatically deploy to the site when a new release tag is pushed.
as i'm building a theme to go onto the marketplace, i'm having to use the Drag and drop interface.
yep, we're looking into that. not sure how far we go before we switch cms. :wink:
(meaning choose something different for public facing web)
yeah
One thing I think we'd all benefit from is if HubSpot published a development roadmap (for dev tools)
Pretty hard to suggest a direction when we're not sure where certain functionality is going!
What about something like this: `{% choice "domain_stylesheets" label='domain stylesheet', value='Default', choices='Default, Include, Exclude', export_to_template_context=True %}`
<@U7SL518D6> not sure if this is something you’re able to help with please? :)
No worries if not!
HubSpot is developing it so marketers can use dnd and developers can use coded files.  Not sure if this answers your question <@UQERM7BLY>
trying to merge two distinct approaches
they spoke a bit about it at dev day at inbound
dont recall the time stamp on the youtube video though
pretty deep in

Ah fantastic thanks for the insight. I see the benefits with both approaches, but I guess as I’m building a theme for the marketplace I’m stuck with using the design manager approach (without dnd hubl)

Not so much a full road map but HubSpotters talked at the Developer Community Meetup at Inbound
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VpArzDy5ny4>

There’s a lot in there on a lot of different aspects of the platform.
currently, yes
It would be super nice if there was a way to export the design manager interface layouts as configuration :)
So it could be version controlled!
You can
Oh really?
enter jon
Excited now haha
(Doesn’t take much)
Yes, using the HubSpot CLI you can download those assets. They come down as JSON. Which you can enter into a git repo.
yep
Perfect!
Best of both
<@U7SL518D6>, is there timeline on the dnd markup?
or is it out and i just missed it
It’s out in beta I think
Been playing around with it
dnd markup is in public beta <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/drag-and-drop-areas>
i mean release
and then jon was gone
<@U54TVT3C1> does that work? Kinda genius :fire:
It seems to work for me.  Haven't tested much though

I don’t have a time-frame for when it will be considered a stable release. The team is focused on doing a really good job with it versus rushing it.

What I would say is play with it - give us feedback in the forums or in <#CDU990ECW|drag-n-drop-pages>. Your feedback shapes the direction and speed we move at.

Great thanks. Yeah, starting to realise that - Ultimately, I’ve only been looking at the platform for a few days just trying to wrap my head around the HubSpot way to do things. Especially as I’m building out a theme for the marketplace. Always the case when there’s a bit of overlap, but think you answering this questions has put me on the right track - thanks.
i appreciate how clever our community is, although i will say doing string replacement like that is pretty fragile :slightly_smiling_face:
Agreed.  Definitely not the most ideal situation
